data.title: Best hostel experience yet!
data.text: Booked the hideaway. Arrived before check-in. Friendly hosts got us a parking spot and some bikes to use around town. Gave excellent suggestions on where to go, where to eat, and how to get there. Hosts felt like housemates, rather than staff members! My Fort Collins trip was great because I stayed at fernweh!

data.title: Most Excellent
data.text: Snoozed and relaxed at the Fernweh whilst in the process of evaluating Fort Collins as a potential habitation zone.  Staff was very professional, very friendly, and Cash is a cool doggo.  Seems like they've got the hostel thing figured out quite well.  Would definitely recommend.

data.title: Home away from Home!
data.text: My wife and I stayed here in September and we both were super impressed.  Like many of the other reviews of Fernweh, we totally agree the value and friendliness is top drawer!  My favorite amenity is the available bikes.  Just grab one and go, and because Fernweh is centrally located you will not have to bike far to enjoy Fort Fun, oops I mean Fort Collins.

data.title: Perfect, economical place to stay for an extended business trip
data.text: Stayed here for an extended business trip and it was a great choice. Super helpful to have access to a full kitchen, living room with plenty of books, Netflicks, etc. and free use of bikes! Everything was super-clean, people were helpful and overall, it was a comfortable home-like environment. Way cheaper than a hotel too!

data.title: They've thought of EVERYTHING
data.text: I've stayed in many hostels in the US and elsewhere, and this is by far the most comfortable! They have literally every little thing you might have forgotten or didn't bring (even bikes to use and a white noise machine) plus a spacious stylish feel and a relaxing garden/patio. Very reasonable price, I would highly recommend!

data.title: Fabulous for groups!
data.text:
I LOVE this place! BEAUTIFUL Inn... Charming, , wonderful old house that has been converted into an inn and hostel.  Everything you need is provided for you. Everything is in great condition. A great place for a get-away, for guests from out of town, and for groups. Very convenient to Old Town Fort Collins. There are bikes available, a BBQ, and a lovely back yard with a seating area and fire pit. 

The staff is gracious, available and detailed. GO!

data.title: Home Away from Home
data.text: Was in Colorado for a couple thousand miles of motorcycling because we lack mountains in Wisconsin. The ride there is over 1100 itself so I figured I could use a day to get off my butt and check out Fort Collins. Chose the Fernweh based upon their positive reviews and I'm happy to say they were completely accurate. Kelsey could not be a more gracious hostess and the house is everything you could hope for in a clean and comfortable home environment to rest your head after a long day. It's conveniently located just a few blocks from many great restaurants and breweries. If you are considering a stay in Fort Collins do yourself a favor and go see Kelsey and Cash. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Best Inn Fort Collins
data.text: It was our first visit to Fort Collins on a trip including several CO cities. Fernweh was hands down the absolute best place we stayed! The loft room was very spacious and had everything we needed. The entire house is beautifully and comfortably decorated and spotless. Tyrus was super friendly and helpful and the outdoor space was perfect. Old Town is an easy walk from Fernweh and there are bikes if you choose to ride. Loved everything about this place. We'll be back!

data.title: Quiet and friendly
data.text: I stayed one night in the Treetop Room, which might be a splurge for one person as it holds 4 people with the added bunk beds, but it was a much better value than staying at a hotel downtown. Kelsey wasn't there but Jielia was available and took the time to recommend restaurants within walking distance and downtown recs including brewpubs. The house is gorgeous, vintage but not old-fashioned, clean and spacious with great water pressure and wifi. One of the guests made zucchini bread from the vegetable garden out back that she shared, and there is a nice lounging area there, and lots of bikes for rental. The door code lock for outside the house is easy to use. Definitely recommend as an option to a hotel, plus you meet people and get a better feel for Fort Collins.

data.title: Home away from home
data.text: Staying at the Fernweh and getting to meet Kelsey and Cash was an awesome experience!!! It has changed the way my husband and I will travel. Due to the fact that we planned our vacation late, we ended up staying in every room in the house, except the women's bunk. Every room was immaculate and had little touches of nature and comfort in them. I also liked that Kelsey was open to allowing pets, as long as you are staying in a private room and take your pet with you whenever you leave; t's not very easy to find places that allow them. The other guests that we met were equally nice and kind. I never once felt uncomfortable or unsafe, it was actually just the opposite. It was fun to talk with the other guests  and find out about their travels. I could go on and on about our time at Fernweh and how much we truly enjoyed our time there. Kelsey is a fantastic hostess and I know that we will return to stay with her again!!!

data.title: Fun & Friendly Fernweh!
data.text: My wife and two children enjoyed Fernweh for two nights in early August. Kelsey and her staff were very friendly and welcoming. We stayed in the 'loft' for one evening, and in a 'bunk' room on our second evening. We found both rooms to be just the perfect space for our group. So Cool!  We enjoyed the community kitchen and the great back yard hammocks too, and she provided 'floating innertubes' too ! Keep up the good work Kelsey. We'll come visit again when we get the chance. Thanks for helping to make our visit to Ft. Collins a memorable one!

data.title: Kiwi longing for home
data.text: A little home sick, but not when the door opened at Fernweh. Friendly, helpful, clean and a fun place to stay. I would not hesitate to stay again.  Thankyou so much to all, for making my holiday even better.

data.title: Great location, clean, generous, friendly, will be back
data.text: We went to the Fernweh for an evening away from Denver. Kelsey was welcoming and kind, it is clear she is dedicated to making everyone's stay comfortable and enjoyable. The room was as expected and the hostel itself provided more than any other hostel I've been to (bikes, free wifi, clean bathrooms, snacks, fan in the room for a hot summer night!) I would highly recommend a stay at the Fernweh to anyone!

data.title: Fantastic Visit Yet Again
data.text: My husband and I stayed with our dog for 5 nights and Kelsey and her staff went above and beyond to make our experience exceptional. We really enjoyed staying in the loft, it was spacious and charming and the claw foot tub was very relaxing. We love that the Fernweh is so close to old town and that we can walk to it, as well as many other attractions. Already looking forward to our next visit.

data.title: Bachelorette Party
data.text:
I am originally from this area and had never heard of their being a hostel in the Fort Collins area. A large group of us stayed here for a bachelorette party weekend. The entire place was rented out except for one room. 
I stayed in the room with the 6 bunk beds. There were lockers underneath the bed with locks and a key to get in and of the room. In our case there was no need to lock our belongings as everybody in the house was part of one group. We did lock the room while we were out on the town.  On each bed there were also little lights that clicked on above each bunk that made it easy to read or do things and not disturb the other sleepers. 
The kitchen was another amazing part of our weekend! We cooked breakfast twice and dinner once during the weekend. We had full use of the coffee pot, ovens, blenders, and other necessities we needed to make our weekend fantastic! There were bins to keep all of our food and belongings together. 
The other part of the hostel that was probably one of the highlights to our weekend was the fire pit! We spent two long evenings in front of the fire in relaxing chairs and hammocks just visiting and enjoying one another's company. I highly recommend this venue whether it is a group event or a weekend getaway! Thanks so much for the stay, I'll be back!

data.title: A wonderful place to stay
data.text:
The hostel is very nice, very clean , they provide bikes and wi-fi free of charge.
The staff are very friendly.The hostel localizationis easy access to other areas of the city. I recommend for all travelers.
Thank you Fernweh.

data.title: Solo
data.text: Both the hostel and the host, Kelsey were fantastic. Everything is very new and homely with great spaces to socialise in. The hostel is amazingly well located just a short walk from the main streets. I would highly recommend staying here!

data.title: Friendly, lovely experience
data.text: This hostel is well cared for and comfortable. You immediately feel owner Kelsey's love of travel when looking around the rooms. Please venture out back to enjoy her new patio/garden. All of her staff is welcoming and helpful. Absolutely recommended and will stay here again.

data.title: Felt like home
data.text: I have stayed at a lot of hostels, and this one was the nicest. I felt like I was staying at someone's home. There was a drawer of costumes and a shelf of costumes, and bikes to borrow. It was clean and decorated nicely, with a lot of common space, and a large kitchen. There is a dog who is very mellow. There is a garden in front and a nice patio in back. Staff and guests were friendly, and there were older guests as well- a nice mix of people. The hostel wasn't loud- important to me as I was in town for a class. Highly recommended!

data.title: Best European Style vacation site near Denver, Boulder and the Front Range.
data.text:
This multi room home is extremely well cared for and very tastefully decorated.  It is like a B&B but you just cook for yourself in the gourmet foodie grade kitchen or sneak off to the delightful dining recommendations from the staff that abound in Ft Collins.  If you are a bike touring Foodie like myself you can make a fun excursion of your trip by mixing and matching Denver's Trains to Union Station, Deluxe Flatiron Flyer Bus to Boulder and FLEX bus M-Sa to Ft Collins.  The bike routes from Boulder to Ft Collins are sweet too.  Fernweh has a bike library.  Ft Collins has almost as many bike shops as microbrewerys. Super duper hill climbs and trails and urban paths followed by Fernweh's claw footed baths and hammocks are waiting for your visit.  When you look in to the lovely hardwood floors of Fernweh; you'll automatically rip off your bike cleats before entering.  It's that classy.  
  Travel light and on you way into town, stop by the Natural Grocers excellent travel section for those small overnight items you don't want to haul.  
  The street out front seems to quiet down around 9pm but earplugs are always a good idea for shared rooms and fan noises.
